title_en: Union warns of summer strikes by council staff in Scotland without a new salary offer
summary_en:
The Unite union has rejected a salary offer from the local authority Cosla.
The proposal increases the salary of municipal employees by 2.2% for 18 months.
Unite confirms plans for key groups of its members to vote for strikes.
General Secretary Sharon Graham rejected the employers' council's proposal, considering it ridiculous.
The struggle to improve jobs, wages and conditions in local government will continue.
Cosla emphasizes that the proposed payment amount is at the limit of accessibility, given the financial difficulties of municipalities.
Unison, the largest local government union in Scotland, also considers the offer to be inadequate to the level that workers deserve.

title_en: The CBSA union warns of June disruptions at the border in connection with the strike sanction
summary_en:
The CBSA union warns of possible June disruptions at the borders due to a possible strike.
The Canadian Public Service Alliance said 9,000 of its members working at CBSA have been given a strike mandate.
The warning could lead to significant disruptions at the borders ahead of the busy summer tourist season.
The union says that in June, workers will be able to hold a legal strike, for which mediation sessions are also scheduled to begin.
The members of the organization have not had a contract for two years and there are problems with receiving salaries and providing remote work opportunities.
Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said the government will continue negotiations to reach an agreement that is fair to employees and taxpayers.
